content: Singaporean actor (born 1960) **Lim Kay Siu** (born 28 February 1960) is a Singaporean character actor who has appeared in several Asian films, television series, and theatrical productions since the 1980s. ## Career In the Western world, Lim is known for his role as Monk Gyatso, in Avatar - The Last Airbender. He is also known for playing the North Korean villain in *[Night Watch](/wiki/Night_Watch_(1995_film))*. The film is set in Hong Kong where he starred alongside [Pierce Brosnan](/wiki/Pierce_Brosnan) and [Alexandra Paul](/wiki/Alexandra_Paul). He also stars as Prince [Chowfa](/wiki/Pinklao), King [Mongkut](/wiki/Mongkut)'s brother ([Chow Yun-fat](/wiki/Chow_Yun-fat)), in *[Anna and the King](/wiki/Anna_and_the_King)*. He appeared in various episodes of the Singapore sitcom *[Phua Chu Kang Pte Ltd](/wiki/Phua_Chu_Kang_Pte_Ltd)* as the title character's main rival, Frankie Foo, between 1997 and 2006. ## Personal life His older brother, [Lim Kay Tong](/wiki/Lim_Kay_Tong), is also an actor and well-known television personality in Singapore. Lim first met his wife, [Neo Swee Lin](/wiki/Neo_Swee_Lin), on her debut theatre performance, *Dragon's Teeth Gate*, in 1986. The two would act as a married couple four years later on the play, *The Moon is Less Bright*. They married on 12 August 1992.
